history.content:
I think the best prep for cs170 would probably be cs61b. If you're planning on taking other EECS/CS courses I highly recommend you take cs70 simply for the reason that in my opinion the class itself will help you develop better problem solving skills.


——-

Probability theory barely get used in 170, so  I would say Stat140 won’t be a proper prerequisite for 170.


The main thing we need from CS70 is how to write proofs and some discreet math(modular arithmetic, graph theory etc).

Also being familiar with data structure (CS61B) is also important for doing well in 170.

I think the best prep for cs170 would probably be cs61b. If you're planning on taking other EECS/CS courses I highly recommend you take cs70 simply for the reason that in my opinion the class itself will help you develop better problem solving skills.
Just wanted to know if taking Stat 140 instead of CS 70 would adequately prepare me for CS 170. If not, what other topics should I self study?
history.subject: Is STAT 140 enough prep for CS 170
